title: What We're Missing, By Missing Strangers Now
description: With a lot of us stuck at home, trying to physically distance from each other, one part of daily life has largely disappeared: bumping into strangers. On today's show, Maddie talks with Yowei Shaw, a reporter from NPR's Invisibilia, about the surprising benefits of stranger interactions. And Short Wave tries out QuarantineChat, a workaround to our current strangerless existence.
copyright: Copyright 2019-2021 NPR - For Personal Use Only
itunes:title: What We're Missing, By Missing Strangers Now
itunes:author: NPR
itunes:summary: Today, the science of what talking to complete randoms can do for you and what we're missing by not bumping into strangers these days.
itunes:subtitle: Today, the science of what talking to complete randoms can do for you and what we're missing by not bumping into strangers these days.
